content.description:
Immediately left of slot entrance to The Firing Chamber is a wide, flaring, dirty slot. This is your route! The crux lies in getting off the ground and into the low angle offwidth above. Slap your way off the ground by bear hugging the flake that makes up the right side of the initial crack before throwing yourself into the easy wideness above. Pull to the top using a combination of loose chockstones, plants, and general thrashing.

It is not a bomb but not worth a star either.
content.location:
It is just a few feet left of the narrow slot/chimney entrance to the Firing Chamber and the route

Deliverance

.

content.description: We used a stupid human trick of stacking a few rocks to just barely reach the finger crack. The crack above roof becomes OW. There is a useful edge on left wall near the roof.
content.location: Right of Firing Chamber along the wall is a corner with a crack that starts rather high and becomes OW at the top, which is the crux.

content.description: Using the diagonal crack for gear, chimney up the crack to the top, an exciting exit. Classic!
content.location: Just inside the Firing Chamber on the right wall is a finger crack. Climb the chimney to the top.

content.description:
Sitting Bull is a short line to the right of

Little Bighorn

. We easily trundled a teetering death block (the Sitting Bull) midway up the route which hints that this is a new route but maybe not....

Do a couple steep moves into a shallow, right-facing corner under a flake. Tackle a short, off-finger crack, and then run it out on easy terrain to the top. Walk off.

This line is short (like the all of the routes up here) but pretty good. It is worthy if you are in the area.
content.location:
It is 20 feet right of

Little Big Horn

under a large flake. There are no fixed anchors. Walk off.

climbs.name: Shelob's Lair
climbs.fa: Alvino Pino and Eric VanDoren (solo), bolts added by Bernard Gillett and John Carey, 2003

content.description: This is a fun chimney protected by three bolts. Get yourself to the proper chimney (see below). Shimmy to the right to get to the first bolt and head straight up.
content.protection: Quickdraws for the bolts. A #0.5 Camalot or equivalent protects the exit move from the chimney. There is no anchor at the top. We built a belay about thirty feet to the left with large cams (#3 and #4 Camalots).
content.location: See the photo for the approach. It's to the right of a good-looking hand- and fist-crack (the route Little Bighorn). Walk into the obvious chimney. After about ten or fifteen feet, there will be a chimney to the right where you'll see the route with its three bolts.

content.description: The route ascends the obvious hand/fist/offwidth crack some 50' left of The Firing Chamber chimney system. Pull through a small bulge off the ground on good hands then continue to the top in the wider but now low angle crack. Belay from gear on the expansive ledge above.
content.location: To the left of The Firing Chamber chimney systems, this is the obvious wide crack splitting the slab.

content.description:
Gunsmoke ascends a third and final chimney, different than the other two, and it is worth doing.

Climb up the back corner of the Firing Chamber, where 3 different sections of chimney intersect. A flaring, offset crack in the narrowest section of chimney offers a few reasonable points of protection sufficient to make the route safe as a trad lead. Climb this to the top, and belay on a large cordalette on some boulders.
content.protection: 1 set of Aliens from small to 1.5" will do just fine.
content.location: Back in the Firing Chamber, the slot takes a right-hand turn and the wide initial chimney narrows significantly. This creates a corner with the intersection of 3 different widths of chimney, which is the route at hand.

content.description: Found just right of the entrance to The Firing Chamber, this route ascends the right-leaning finger crack to its end before firing up the crux slab above. Once on top, a large boulder may be slung for an anchor.
content.protection: A couple pieces to 1" and 1 bolt.
content.location: This is near the far right end of the Fourth Band, directly right of the narrow slot marking the entrance to The Firing Chamber.

pathTokens: South Fork of St. Vrain Canyon
